conclusion: Analyze the motion of the basketball before and after collision considering air resistance and gravity.
Basketball is dropped from rest at height H, gravitational force is mg, air resistance is λmg with 0 < λ < (H-h)/(H+h).
Net downward force during fall is (1 - λ)mg.
Velocity just before collision is v_1 = sqrt(2(1 - λ)gH).
Net upward force during ascent is (1 + λ)mg.
Velocity just after collision is v_2 = sqrt(2(1 + λ)gh).
Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is v_2/v_1 = sqrt((1 + λ)h/(1 - λ)H).
Final answer: Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is sqrt((1 + λ)h/(1 - λ)H).
